bug.short_desc: [epub] EPUB validation tests should only download EpubCheck when required

long_desc.thetext: These tests download the epubcheck library in order to validate the generated test. However the download sometimes times out due to bad or no internet connection. So it should be possible to turn these tests off and also cache the downloaded libraries for offline building.

I'm not aware of any existing switches that can be used so I think I'll just make up a new one. It appears that the downloaded jars are cleaned out by Hudson so I need another location outside of the Hudson workspace for caching the jars. Any ideas?

After discussing with Steffen @ EclipseCon I'll do the following: * Only attempt to download the library if it's not only present. Hudson is not cleaning the repository between builds (only a mvn clean is executed). * Attempt to make use of the Maven "offline" option to detect whether or not the validation tests should be executed if the library is not present.
EpubCheck 3.0 Beta 4 should be used instead of version 1.2 as this is now the recommended version. See http://code.google.com/p/epubcheck/
Note that as the EpubCheck and tests in question are an integral part of the project it is not straightforard to remove these. I'll settle for only downloading EpubCheck when required.
Created attachment 213535 Patch to download EpubCheck only if not already present
Closing resolved issues in released product.

attachment.desc: Patch to download EpubCheck only if not already present
